eu.focusnet.app.model

Class PageInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.focusnet.app.model.AbstractInstance
      • eu.focusnet.app.model.PageInstance

  • public class PageInstance
extends AbstractInstance
    The instantiation of a page pageTemplate, consisting of widgets. A PageInstance can have an iterator, too. In this case, one page will be created for each item in the iterator.

      • parentProjectTemplate

      • pageTemplate

        private PageTemplate pageTemplate
        Page pageTemplate

      • guid

        private java.lang.String guid
        Page unique identifier. If the page has an iterator, then the guid will be updated once the iterator will have been resolved such that paths can reflect the different between the different instances generated by this iterator.

      • type

        private PageInstance.PageType type
        Category of the page

      • title

        Title of the page

      • description

      • disabled

        private boolean disabled
        Tells whether this page is disabled or not. If this is the case, it should be be accessible.

      • widgets

        private java.util.ArrayList<WidgetInstance> widgets
        List of widget instances included in this page.

                                                                    PageInstance.PageType pageType,
                                                                    DataContext parentContext)
        Factory to create page instances
        Parameters:
        projectTemplate - The project pageTemplate to take as a basis for generating the page instances.
        pageType - The category of page we are interested in
        parentContext - The DataContext to use as a basis for data resolution
        Returns:
        A list of PageInstances

      • addWidget

        public void addWidget(WidgetInstance wi)
        Add a widget instance to the current page

        If any of the widget instances is not valid, then the page is considered as not valid (but it will still be displayed anyway).

        We never pass invalid widgets to a PageInstance. Instead, we pass an InvalidWidgetInstance that contains a reference to the invalid widget instance.

        Parameters:
        wi - The WidgetInstance to add.

        Tells whether the current instance is disabled.
